doc.name: installation
doc.description:
Grab in instance from the https://bitbucket.org/wikibasesolutions/mw-wsform/. Create a "WSForm" folder in your Wiki extensions folder and extract the files there.

By default the handling of Forms is done outside the Wiki1. This allows for closed wiki's to still have anonymous users fill in forms.

This means you need to create a user specifically for WSForm. This can be a new user or you can create a BOT account from your own account. Below is described how to add a new user:

  • go to Special:CreateAccount and create an account e.g. formsubmitter
  • Set the appropriate rights in Special:UserRights (preferably Admin/bureaucrat rights
  • Open /WSForm/config/config_default.php fill the username and password you just created2
  • If you on a FARM add the path to the FARM3

  • Save the file as config.php


If you are on FARM you can add a WSFormSettings.php in the wiki/name folder with the following content :



$this->app['username']='...';
$this->app['password']='...';

For uploading files the user created will need to have the rights for :

  • upload

  • uploadfile

  • upload_by_url

General settings (in localsettings.php) that need to be enabled :

  • $wgAllowCopyUploads = true;

  • $wgCopyUploadsFromSpecialUpload = true;


Finally add the following line at the end of your LocalSettings.php to enable the extension :

wfLoadExtension( 'WSForm' );

WSForm has a notification system build in. This is used to show possible errors or success / custom messages.

To enable this.. add to your header page :
doc.note: Make sure you have in e.g. your header page that is shown on every page. This will show possible error messages that might occur and allows for the messageonsuccess option to work.
